Recovery Strategies

Recovery Strategies for GeminiSDR Error Handling

This module provides specific recovery strategies for different types of errors that can occur in the GeminiSDR system, including hardware failures, configuration issues, and memory problems.

class geminisdr.core.recovery_strategies.RecoveryStrategies(logger: Logger | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Collection of recovery strategies for different error types.

Each strategy is a callable that takes (error, context) and returns a boolean indicating whether recovery was successful.

__init__(logger: Logger | None = None)[source]
hardware_to_simulation_fallback(error: HardwareError, context: ErrorContext) → bool[source]

Fallback from hardware to simulation mode when hardware is unavailable.

Parameters:

  • error – The hardware error that occurred

  • context – Error context information

Returns:

True if fallback was successful

Return type:

bool

gpu_to_cpu_fallback(error: MemoryError, context: ErrorContext) → bool[source]

Fallback from GPU to CPU when GPU memory is exhausted.

Parameters:

  • error – The memory error that occurred

  • context – Error context information

Returns:

True if fallback was successful

Return type:

bool

reduce_batch_size_recovery(error: MemoryError, context: ErrorContext) → bool[source]

Reduce batch size when memory is insufficient.

Parameters:

  • error – The memory error that occurred

  • context – Error context information

Returns:

True if batch size was successfully reduced

Return type:

bool

configuration_default_fallback(error: ConfigurationError, context: ErrorContext) → bool[source]

Use default configuration values when configuration is invalid.

Parameters:

  • error – The configuration error that occurred

  • context – Error context information

Returns:

True if default configuration was applied

Return type:

bool

model_version_fallback(error: ModelError, context: ErrorContext) → bool[source]

Try to load an alternative model version when model loading fails.

Parameters:

  • error – The model error that occurred

  • context – Error context information

Returns:

True if alternative model was loaded

Return type:

bool

memory_cleanup_recovery(error: MemoryError, context: ErrorContext) → bool[source]

Perform aggressive memory cleanup to recover from memory errors.

Parameters:

  • error – The memory error that occurred

  • context – Error context information

Returns:

True if memory cleanup was successful

Return type:

bool

retry_with_delay_recovery(error: Exception, context: ErrorContext) → bool[source]

Generic retry strategy with delay for transient errors.

Parameters:

  • error – The error that occurred

  • context – Error context information

Returns:

True if retry should be attempted

Return type:

bool

get_all_strategies() → Dict[type, list][source]

Get all available recovery strategies mapped to error types.

Returns:

Dict mapping error types to lists of recovery strategies

property is_simulation_mode: bool

Check if system is currently in simulation mode.

property is_cpu_fallback_active: bool

Check if CPU fallback is currently active.

reset_fallback_states() → None[source]

Reset all fallback states to normal operation.

Set up default recovery strategies for an ErrorHandler instance.

  • logger – Optional logger for recovery strategies
